episode_title: 112 - The One With the Dozen Lasagnes

credits.writtenBy: Jeffrey Astrof, Mike Sikowitz, Adam Chase & Ira Ungerleider

note: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there. Ross working on crossword puzzle, starts humming theme from The Odd Couple. Chandler joins in, followed by Monica and Phoebe, then the whole gang. Ross starts humming theme from I Dream Of Jeannie.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no, we’re done.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is on the phone in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aunt Syl, stop yelling! All I’m saying is that if you had told me vegetarian lasagna, I would have made vegetarian lasagna. (pauses, listens to person on phone) Well, the meat’s only every third layer, maybe you could scrape.
(Camera moves to Chandler, Phoebe, Ross, and Joey sitting in living room)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, did you really read all these baby books?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yup! You could plunk me down in the middle of any woman’s uterus, no compass, and I can find my way out of there like that! (snaps fingers)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, this is cool…it says in some parts of the world, people actually eat the placenta. (Joey grimaces)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And, we’re done with the yogurt. (Sets yogurt down on table)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry. (Camera pans back to Monica, still on phone)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aunt Syl, I did this as a favor, I am not a caterer. What do you want me to do with a dozen lasagnas? (listens to Aunt Syl on phone, looks shocked) Nice talk, Aunt Syl. (in New York accent) You kiss Uncle Freddie with that mouth?
(Camera pans back to group in living room)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross, listen, you know that right now, your baby’s only this big? (measures about 2 inches with his thumb and index finger) This is your baby. (in baby-like voice) Hi Daddy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How come you don’t live with Mommy? (pause; shows Ross less than amused) How come Mommy lives with that other lady? (pause; Ross still looks less than amused; Joey smiling) What’s a lesbian? (playfully hits Ross)
(Rachel enters with Paolo, speaking Italian. Ross looks annoyed)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, you can say it, Poconos, Poconos, it’s like Poc-o-nos (touching Paolo’s nose with forefinger with each syllable)

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Ah, poke (Paolo touches Rachel’s nose) a (touches nose again) nose, mmm (they rub noses, then kisses her)

content.speaker: Joey, Chandler, and Ross
content.text: Mma, Mma, Mmaah
content.parenthetical: sitting in living room, imitating Paolo

content.text: (Camera pans to Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe in the kitchen)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, did I hear Poconos?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, my sister’s giving us her place for the weekend.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Woo-hoo, first weekend away together!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, that’s a big step.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know…
(Camera pans to Ross, looking dejected)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, it’s just a weekend, big deal!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wasn’t this supposed to be just a fling, huh? Shouldn’t it be…(makes flinging motions with hands) flung by now?
(Camera pans back to Rachel)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, we are way past the fling thing, I mean, I am feeling things that I’ve only read about in Danielle Steele books, you know? I mean, when I’m with him, I’m totally, totally…
(Camera pans to Ross, holding his stomach)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …nauseous, I’m physically nauseous. What am I supposed to do, huh? Call immigration? (pauses, looks suddenly inspired) I could call immigration!

content.description: The Hallway, Chandler and Joey leaving girls’ apartment, carrying lasagna.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I love babies, with their little baby shoes, and their little baby toes, and their little baby hands…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, you’re going to have to stop that, forever!
(Joey opens door, throws keys on kitchen table, table falls over)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Need a new table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You think?

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, there’s a knock on the door and Carol answers it to Ross.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey hey, come on in!
(Ross enters, carrying lasagna)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hello! mmwa! (kisses Carol) I brought all the books, and Monica sends her love, along with this lasagna.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh great! Is it vegetarian, ’cause Susan doesn’t eat meat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m pretty sure that it is…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: So, I got the results of the amnio today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, tell me, tell me, is everything, uhh…?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Totally and completely healthy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that’s great, that is great! (Hugs and kisses Carol. Then picks up a picture frame)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, when did you and Susan meet Huey Lewis?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Uh, that’s our friend Tanya.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course it’s your friend Tanya. (looks up frightenedly)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Don’t you want to know about the sex?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The sex? (chuckles) Um, I’m having enough trouble with the image of you and Susan together, when you throw in Tanya (miming washing hair, that’s the best I could think of), yaw…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: The sex of the baby, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you know the sex of the baby? Oh, oh-oh-oh!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Do you want to know?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no, no, no, I don’t want to know, absolutely not. I think, you know, I think you should know until you look down there, and say, oop, there it is! (pauses) Or isn’t…
(Susan enters)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, hello Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Susan…

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: So, so, did you hear?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, we did, everything’s A-OK!

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, that’s so… (Susan hugs Carol, they giggle, Ross steps away) It really is…do we know…?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Yes, we certainly do, it’s going to be…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hey hey hey, ho ho ho, hello, guy who doesn’t want to know, standing right here!

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, well, is it what we thought it would be?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Mm-hmmm (Susan and Carol hug, giggling. Ross stands back, reaches out and lightly taps Susan’s shoulder)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, what, what…ok, what did we think it was going to be?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no I don’t want to know, don’t want to know. Ok, you know, I should probably, I should probably just go.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Well, thanks for the books.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No problem, ok, mmmwa (kisses Carol) oh, mmmwa (kisses Carol’s stomach, then punches Susan’s shoulder) Susan… (Ross leaves.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: All right, who should we call first, your folks, or Deb and Rona? (intercom buzzer rings)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, never mind, I don’t want to know. (Carol and Susan laugh)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler use their knees as a table to support the lasagna.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, so it’s just because it was my table, I have to buy a new one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s the rule.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What rule? There’s no rule, if anything, you owe me a table!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’d you get to that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I believe the piece of furniture was fine until your little breakfast adventure with Angela Delvecchio

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You knew about that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, let’s just say the impressions you made in the butter left little to the imagination.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, ok, How about if we split it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What do you mean, like, buy it together?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You think we’re ready for something like that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s a pretty big commitment, I mean, what if one of us wants to move out?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why, are you moving out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not moving out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’d tell me if you were moving out right

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, yeah, it’s just that with my last roommate Kip…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aw, I know all about Kip!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s just that we bought a hibachi together, and then he ran off and got married, and things got pretty ugly.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, let me ask you something, was Kip a better roommate than me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aw, don’t do that

content.description: Phoebe’s Massage Parlor, Phoebe’s assistant is telling her about the changes to her schedule.

content.speaker: Phoebe’s Assistant
content.text: We’ve got a couple changes in your schedule. Your 4:00 herbal massage has been pushed back to 4:30 and Miss Somerfield canceled her 5:30 shiatsu.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, thanks. (assistant leaves, then walks back in)

content.speaker: Phoebe’s Assistant
content.text: Oh, here comes your 3:00. I don’t mean to sound unprofessional, but, yum (walks out, Paolo enters)

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Buon Giorno, Bella Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Paolo, hi, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Uh, Racquela tell me you massage, eh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, Racquela’s right, yeah!
(Paolo speaks Italian)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, I don’t know what you just said, so let’s get started.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Uh, I am, uh, being naked?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, that’s really your decision, I mean, some people prefer, you know, to take off…oh whoops! You’re being naked!

content.description: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe is there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe you don’t want to know. I mean, I couldn’t not know, I mean, if, if the doctor knows, and Carol knows, and Susan knows…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Monica knows…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha, heh, how could you know, I don’t even know!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Carol called me to thank me for the lasagna, I asked, she told me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what’s it gonna be? (Monica whispers in Joey’s ear. Ross gets up and waves arms frantically in protest)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait—oh—hey—huh, oh great now he knows, and I don’t know!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m just excited about being an aunt!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or an uncle…
(Phoebe enters)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Phoebe!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Pheebs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing, I’m sorry, I’m just, I’m out of sorts.

content.speaker: Customer
content.text: Hey, can we get some cappuccino over here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, right, that’s me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Chandler, that table place closes at 7, come on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine. (Joey and Chandler walk towards the door)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, what is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, you know Paolo?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m familiar with his work, yes…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he made a move on me.
(Joey and Chandler come back)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, store will be open tomorrow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: More coffee over here, please!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what happened?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he came in for a massage, and everything was fine until. (A flashback starts Paolo, lying on massage table, moving his hands up Phoebe’s legs.)
[Cut back to Central Perk.]

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: Ooooohh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure?
(The flashback resumes with Paolo grabbing her butt.)
[Cut back to Central Perk.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, I’m sure. (Flashback resumes with Phoebe doing a voiceover.) And all of a sudden his hands weren’t the problem anymore. (Flashback continues: Paolo rolls over, Phoebe looks down, then quickly looks up, bites lip, shakes her head)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Was it…?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, boy scouts could have camped under there.

content.speaker: Guys
content.text: Oooooo…
(Rachel runs over)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “Ooo,” what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uma Thurman.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The actress!
(all talking indistinctly, high-fiving)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks Rach.
(Rachel walks away)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You have to tell her! You have to tell her! It’s your moral obligation, as a friend, as a woman, I think it’s a feminist issue! Guys? Guys? (waiting for guys to chime in)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, you have to tell her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Feminist issue. That’s where I went!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She is gonna hate me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well…

content.description: The Table Store, Joey and Chandler and looking for their new table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you pick one, just pick one! Here, how about that one? (points to a table)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s patio furniture!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what, like people are gonna come in and think, “Uh-oh, I’m outside again?” Of course!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What about the birds?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, birds just don’t say, “Hello, sit here, eat something.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You pick one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, how about the ladybugs?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so, forget about the birds, but big red insects suggest fine dining!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine, you want to get the birds, get the birds!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not like that, I won’t! (pauses) Kip would have liked the birds! (Joey turns and gives Chandler a dirty look)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel folding and packing clothes in suitcases as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you moving out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, these aren’t all my suitcases. (picks up small blue suitcase and shows to Phoebe) This one’s Paolo’s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, um, Rachel can we talk for a sec?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, sure…just a sec, though, ’cause Paolo’s on his way over.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! (sits down) Ok, um, ok, um,

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Pheebs, Pheebs…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, um, (clears throat) we haven’t known each other for that long a time, and, um, there are three things that you should know about me. One, my friends are the most important thing in my life, two, I never lie, and three, I make the best oatmeal raisin cookies in the world. (Phoebe opens a tin and offers Rachel a cookie)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, thanks Pheebs (takes bite of cookie, overwhelmed) Oh my God, why have I never tasted these before?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I don’t make them a lot because I don’t think it’s fair to the other cookies

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, well, you’re right, these are the best oatmeal cookies I’ve ever had.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which proves that I never lie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I guess you don’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Paolo made a pass at me.
(Rachel looks stunned)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross, Chandler, Joey, and Monica admiring their new table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, what do you think?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think It’s the most beautiful table I’ve ever seen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know!
(The camera pans back to reveal Joey and Chandler’s new foosball table.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So how does this work, you going to balance the plates on these little guys’ heads?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who cares, we’ll eat at the sink! Come on, let’s play!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Heads up Ross! (Monica scores on Chandler and Joey) Score! (points at Chandler) You suck!
(Chandler looks at Joey in amazement)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is recovering from the shock.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I need some milk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, I’ve got milk (takes thermos from her bag and starts to pour a cup) Here you go… (Rachel drinks straight from thermos) Oh!(Rachel finishes thermos) Better?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No… oh , I feel so stupid! Oh, I think about the other day with you guys and I was all “Oh, Paolo, he’s so great, he makes me feel so…” Oh, God, I’m so embarrassed!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m so embarrassed, I’m the one he hit on!
(Phoebe’s and Rachel’s lines overlap)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, if I had never met him this never would have happened!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m so sorry! No I’m sorry! No I’m sorry! No I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, wait, oh, what are we sorry about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know…right, he’s the pig!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Such a pig!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God, he’s such a pig,

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh he’s like a…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s like a big disgusting…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …like a…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …pig…pig man!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, good! Ok…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, but he was my pig man…how did I not see this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! I know! (Rachel startled) It’s because… he’s gorgeous, and he’s charming, and when he looks at you…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Ok, Pheebs…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The end.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Should I not have told you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, trust, me, it’s, it’s, it’s much better that I know. Uh, I just liked it better before it was better…
(Phoebe scoots her chair over to Rachel and hugs her)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Phoebe is telling everyone how it went across the hall as the foosball game continues.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think she took it pretty well. You know Paolo’s over there right now, so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We should get over there and see if she’s okay. (switching places with Ross) Just one…second! Score! (Monica scores, high-fives with Ross) Game! Come on. (Monica and Phoebe leave)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah…ooh! Well, looks like, uh, we kicked your butts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, she kicked our butts. You could be on the Olympic standing-there team.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, two on one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you still doing here? She just broke up with the guy, it’s time for you to swoop in!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, now is when you swoop! You gotta make sure that when Paolo walks out of there, the first guy Rachel sees is you, She’s gotta know that you’re everything he’s not! You’re like, like the anti-Paolo!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My Catholic friend is right. She’s distraught. You’re there for her. You pick up the pieces, and then you usher in the age of Ross! (Ross and Chandler look off into the distance. Joey, wondering what they are looking at, looks in the same direction)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s Balcony, Rachel is throwing Paolo’s clothes over the side.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: No, that’s cold, that’s cold, that’s…
[Cut to inside the apartment.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How’s it going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t stare. Now she just finished throwing his clothes off the balcony, now there’s just a lot of gesturing and arm-waving, (shows Rachel gesturing with hands in front of her chest), Ok, that is either, “How could you?” or, “Enormous breasts!” Here he comes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh!
(Paolo enters. Ross, Phoebe, and Monica scatter)

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Uh, I am, uh, to say good-bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ok bye-bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Paolo, I really hate you for what you did to Rachel, (hands him a lasagna) but I still have five of these, so heat it at 375 until the cheese bubbles.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Grazie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Paolo, I-I just want to tell you and I think I speak for everyone when I say… (shuts door in his face and walks away)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, just look at her… (girls move toward Rachel on the balcony)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh you guys, I-I really think just one of us should go out there so she’s not overwhelmed…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you’re right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …and I really think it should be me.
[Cut to the balcony, Ross has just climbed through the window.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You all right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I’ve been better…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come here. (he hugs Rachel) Listen, you deserve so much better than him…you know, I mean, you, you, you should be with a guy who knows what he has when he has you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Ross…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am so sick of guys. I don’t want to look at another guy, I don’t want to think about another guy, I don’t even want to be near another guy. (Ross crosses arms)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, you’re so great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhhh (Hugs her and sighs)
[Cut to inside the apartment, Rachel and Ross are entering.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh…hey honey, are you all right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You ok?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …medium…hmm…any cookies left?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See, Rach, uh, see, I don’t think that swearing off guys altogether is the answer. I really don’t. I think that what you need is to develop a more sophisticated screening process.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. I just need to be by myself for a while, you know? I just got to figure out what I want

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, no, no, see, because not…not all guys are going to be a Paolo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I know, I know, and I’m sure your little boy is not going to grow up to be one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I’m, I’m having a boy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh…no. No, no, in fact, you’re not having a boy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha-I’m having, I’m having a boy! (babbling) Huh, am I having a boy?

content.speaker: Girls
content.text: Yes, you’re having a boy! (Monica runs over and hugs Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m having a boy! Oh, I’m having a boy!
(Joey and Chandler run in)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wha-

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wha-

content.speaker: Joey and Chandler
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m having a boy! I-I’m having a boy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We already knew that! (they hug)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m having a son. Um…
(Ross looks scared)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Monica is busy killing Chandle and Joey at foosball.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes ! And that would be a shut-down!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shut-out!! (They both start heading for their rooms.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where are you guys going? Come on, one more game!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, it’s 2:30 in the morning!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, get out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You guys are always hanging out in my apartment! Come on, I’ll only use my left hand, huh? Come on, wussies! (Joey and Chandler pick her up) All right, ok, I gotta go. I’m going, (they throw her out) and I’m gone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: One more game?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah!
